item.title: [HIVE-1764] Add command for DESCRIBE indexes
item.description:
Followup for HIVE-1497

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment:
Also, one other followup from HIVE-1497:

  • Use MetaStoreUtils.getColumnNamesFromFieldSchema in getAllColumnsInformation(Index)

item.title: [HIVE-1765] Add queryid while locking
item.description: It would be very useful to figure out who is holding the lock

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: +1 running tests.
Committed! Thanks Namit!

item.title: [HIVE-1766] Dynamic partition is not working as expected.
item.description:
Create source table
------------------
CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE testmove (

a string,

b string

)

PARTITIONED BY (cust string, dt string);
Data has been kept in /usr/hive/warehouse/testmove/cust=a/dt=20100102/a.txt
a.txt has 1 row the value is "a", "b"

Create Destination table
-----------------------
CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE testmove1 (

a string,

b string

)

PARTITIONED BY (cust string, dt string)
Run the query for dynamic partion insert
---------------------------------------
set hive.exec.dynamic.partition=true;

set hive.exec.dynamic.partition.mode=nonstrict;

FROM testmove t

INSERT OVERWRITE TABLE testmove1 PARTITION (cust, dt)
SELECT t.a, t.b, 'a', '20100102';

output
-------
otal MapReduce jobs = 2
Launching Job 1 out of 2
Number of reduce tasks is set to 0 since there's no reduce operator
Execution log at: /tmp/root/root_20101103170404_9e869676-7bb5-4655-b027-5bcb4b7fa2cb.log
Job running in-process (local Hadoop)
2010-11-03 17:04:06,818 null map = 100%, reduce = 0%
Ended Job = job_local_0001
Ended Job = -645725555, job is filtered out (removed at runtime).
Moving data to: file:/tmp/hive-root/hive_2010-11-03_17-03-59_979_5901061386316364507/-ext-10000
Loading data to table testmove1 partition (cust=null, dt=null)
[Warning] could not update stats.
OK

If i run as static partion is the data is inserted in to destination table.

FROM testmove t

INSERT OVERWRITE TABLE testmove1 PARTITION (cust='a', dt='20100102')
SELECT t.a, t.b;
item.environment: Linux, Got the latest code from hive trunk and also tested in 0.6. hadoop version 0.20
item.summary: Dynamic partition is not working as expected.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: The data format was wrong. I have used CSV format with quotes. Which was not supported in hive.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: The data format was wrong. I have used CSV format with quotes. Which was not supported in hive.

item.title: [HIVE-1767] Merge files does not work with dynamic partition
item.summary: Merge files does not work with dynamic partition

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Can you elaborate the bug in the description?

When there is a dynamic partition, the merge task never gets launched. I was trying to figure out what's happening there.

It turns out a bug in ConditionalResolverMergeFiles that leads to the size information counted is not correct for dp queries.

Attached a patch for it.

load data local inpath '/Users/heyongqiang/Documents/workspace/Hive-Index/data/files/srcbucket20.txt' INTO TABLE srcpart_merge_dp partition(ds='2008-04-08', hr=11);
load data local inpath '/Users/heyongqiang/Documents/workspace/Hive-Index/data/files/srcbucket21.txt' INTO TABLE srcpart_merge_dp partition(ds='2008-04-08', hr=11);
load data local inpath '/Users/heyongqiang/Documents/workspace/Hive-Index/data/files/srcbucket22.txt' INTO TABLE srcpart_merge_dp partition(ds='2008-04-08', hr=11);
load data local inpath '/Users/heyongqiang/Documents/workspace/Hive-Index/data/files/srcbucket23.txt' INTO TABLE srcpart_merge_dp partition(ds='2008-04-08', hr=11);

The test needs to be updated

+1

running tests
Committed. Thanks Yongqiang

item.title: [HIVE-1768] Update transident_lastDdlTime only if not specified
item.description:
Currently, whenever a table/partition is created/altered, the field 'transient_lastDdl' time is updated with the current timestamp. For normal operations, this is the desired behavior. However for some housekeeping tasks, it may be helpful if the user could keep the existing value (or set it to something different).

One example where this is useful is if a partition is copied between clusters. If the last modified time were kept same after the initial copy, it would be easy to know if one partition were overwritten/updated by comparing timestamps.

This patch alters the behavior of create/alter methods in the metastore API to update the timestamp only if it is not specified in the object.
item.summary: Update transident_lastDdlTime only if not specified

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
1 Question: Does add partition/drop partition change the transient_lastDdlTime of the table ?
Looks like it does not (from the code) -

Is that the expected/correct semantics ?
Well, the existing behavior is that adding/dropping a partition does not change the transient_lastDdlTimes for the table, so this patch keeps the status quo.
Committed. Thanks Paul

item.title: [HIVE-1769] pcr.q output is non-deterministic
item.description:
Noticed this after merging the patch.

Can you take care of this ?

Also, can you run it on a smaller data set ? - the output is just too big.

item.title: [HIVE-1770] update opToParts list in PartitionPruner.prune() itself - reduces the possibility of bugs.
item.description: A follow-up for HIVE-1750
item.summary: update opToParts list in PartitionPruner.prune() itself - reduces the possibility of bugs.

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [HIVE-1771] ROUND(infinity) chokes
item.description:
Since 1-arg ROUND returns an integer, it's hard to fix this without either losing data (return NULL) or making a backwards-incompatible change (return DOUBLE instead of BIGINT).

In any case, we should definitely fix 2-arg ROUND to preserve infinity/NaN/etc, since it is already returning double.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Example of error currently given.

Caused by: org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.metadata.HiveException: Unable to execute method public org.apache.hadoop.io.LongWritable org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.udf.UDFRound.evaluate(org.apache.hadoop.hive.serde2.io.DoubleWritable)
on object org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.udf.UDFRound@7817bcd4 of class org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.udf.UDFRound with arguments

{Infinity:org.apache.hadoop.hive.serde2.io.DoubleWritable}

of size 1

Note that MySQL ROUND doesn't have this problem since it makes the return type match the arg type.
This patch fixes the two-arg version, but leaves the one-arg version as is.
https://reviews.apache.org/r/53/diff/#index_header
Committed. Thanks John

item.title: [HIVE-1772] optimize join followed by a groupby
item.description:
explain SELECT x.key, count(1) FROM src1 x JOIN src y ON (x.key = y.key) group by x.key;

STAGE DEPENDENCIES:
Stage-1 is a root stage
Stage-2 depends on stages: Stage-1
Stage-0 is a root stage

The above query issues 2 map-reduce jobs.
The first MR job performs the join, whereas the second MR performs the group by.
Since the data is already sorted, the group by can be performed in the reducer of the join itself.
item.summary: optimize join followed by a groupby

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: initial patch.. dependent to HIVE-2339

A group of us is trying to do this for a class project. We want to parallelize the process of JOIN followed by GROUP BY as follows-
The Map job is the same: it takes in two TableScanOperators (as well as any FilterOperators) as well as two ReduceSinkOperators.
The Reduce job, while computing the joins in the JoinOperator also groups the results and performs any aggregates. It then pushes the results directly to a FileSinkOperator without having a separate GroupByOperator.

Does anyone have suggestions on where we can get started in the code? Looking at Hive's architecture overview, it seems we want to make changes to the Query Plan Generator in the compiler to generate different map-reduce tasks for queries that include Join followed by Group By. We are thinking of beginning with trying to modify src/ql/src/java/org/apache/hadoop/hive/ql/QueryPlan.java but weren't sure if this was the right approach. Any input on how you think we should approach this would be great!

@Radhika Malik
I thought YSMART(HIVE-2206) seemed to be merged shortly so I abandoned this. But you can continue if you want.

With HIVE-2206, cases mentioned in this jira will be optimized by Correlation Optimizer. Please check correlationoptimizer1.q to correlationoptimizer14.q for unit test queries of HIVE-2206.correlationoptimizer1.q is one of the most relevant files.

I am closing this jira as "Not A Problem"

item.title: [HIVE-1773] Log a sample of the data at each phase of the plan
item.description: Having the ability to visually inspect the data at the end of each step (as a multi-step query is executing) would be a useful debugging aid. This could be simply logging a small sample of the (input and output?) rows in each map and reduce phase.
item.summary: Log a sample of the data at each phase of the plan

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Committed. Thanks Yongqiang

item.title: [HIVE-1775] Assertation on inputObjInspectors.length in Groupy operator
item.description:
In the Groupby Operator:
Line 188: assert (inputObjInspectors.length == 1);
But this assertion may not necessary true
item.summary: Assertation on inputObjInspectors.length in Groupy operator

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Probably a dup of HIVE-1215.
Yes. I can just comment out this assertion.
resolved in patch hive-1754

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: This bug is fixed in Hive-1754

item.title: [HIVE-1776] parallel execution and auto-local mode combine to place plan file in wrong file system
item.description:
A query (that i can't reproduce verbatim) submits a job to a MR cluster with a plan file that is resident on the local file system. This job obviously fails.

This seems to result from an interaction between the parallel execution (which is trying to run one local and one remote job at the same time). Turning off either the parallel execution mode or the auto-local mode seems to fix the problem.
item.summary: parallel execution and auto-local mode combine to place plan file in wrong file system

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: the problem is that tasks are trying to modify the shared hive configuration object and trampling each other. fix is to clone the configuration object before modifying it in the Task.

This line is removed from MapRedTask.java:

ctx.setOriginalTracker(conf.getVar(HiveConf.ConfVars.HADOOPJT));

I assume this is intentional.

yeah it was - but shoot - i forgot to take out the corresponding call in the finally block to restore the tracker. will upload new patch.

these are no longer necessary because we are using a cloned configuration object that is discarded once the task completes.

+1

running tests
Committed. Thanks Joy

item.title: [HIVE-1777] Outdated comments for GenericUDTF.close()
item.description: In a GenericUDTF, rows can be forward()'ed on close(), contrary to what the comment says.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: +1. Will commit.
Committed. Thanks Paul!
